official_title: To direct the Secretary of the Interior to conduct a study of the Escalante Canyon region of Utah for potential inclusion in the National Park System.

summary.text: Escalante Canyons Study Act of 1991 - Directs the Secretary of the Interior to study and report recommendations to the President and the Congress on the potential establishment of the Escalante Canyon area in Utah as a unit of the National Park System. Authorizes appropriations.

titles.title: To direct the Secretary of the Interior to conduct a study of the Escalante Canyon region of Utah for potential inclusion in the National Park System.
